verbatim_example: I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse.
I've lurked around here for a while and posted a few times, the odd comment and OP. With the best hit of the day over and done with, I am now at a bored loss.
In less than three weeks I'll be a year clean.
This time I avoided any phone calls that I knew would get to me, but my dad knows something is up and just pray he doesn't drive up (I live an hour away). I will not use for 3-4 days
It's been about 48 hours since last Kratom dose, I'm on day 20 I believe from last DHC/Xanax dose.
These cravings are relentless. I think about the drugs I haven't tried... But it's so fucking hard to stay sober when I still feel so empty and just bored everyday.
I know it's bound to happen again in the future.
I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love.
I'd usually take 2 and snort a half of one for a fast, hard come up and a pretty long high. Is there's a better way for me to dose these?
I got my hands on some 300/30 APAP codeines and was wondering how many I would have to CWE to get a buzz going

Started with Narco 10s in highschool, worked my way up to pink oxys, then A 214s, then A 215s, and you know how it goes. Now I'm in college and I love the rush and buzz from railing a roxy and popping 2 more,
haven't had any opis in months
In two days, I will be completely out of meds.
I know I am going to be in pain. I know I will want to use.
Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia,
I start my new job in a couple of hours and haven't been to bed yet. It's going to be so weird working SOBER.
She asks me if I want to shoot up with her. This is just so tempting. Just for today, I will not relapse. What about tomorrow tho.
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
I know you're not medical professionals, but I know I have everything I need to detox at home.
I have been taking kratom since Tuesday to help withdrawal.
This is the only period of sobriety I've had in 10 years.
I used to run one in r/opiates
I was in a hospital bed, could barely walk and breathe, was doing the â€œundercover ninjaâ€ every night to try and get comfortable to sleep, and had no direction or positive things in my life.
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia; I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out...
Hoping I can take some of the good from yesterday and harness it today. Dropping the Lope to 4mg and possibly the same GABA/Kpin dosage.
Waking up to day 7. Sleep was total shit and so is this morning. Right now feels so discouraging... hopefully the day gets better...
I'll take that over just bad.
Eight days down, moving into day 9.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.
This past weekend was better than the last... Nothing has felt very pink or cloud-like thus far. Just sticking to my daily regiment/diet etc and waiting for a wave of reprieve from this next phase.

Today I feel... decent? It feels like my body is trying to act normal and my brain is just a few steps behind. Sort of feels like I'm a more functional shell of myself... in a good way.
Slept a straight 7 hours last night. Two morning GI episodes. Only really annoying thing left from the physical side is clammy hands, feet, pits.
Closing in on 3 weeks, Still some morning GI stuff.
Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.

Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs. Hoping some of the above starts to clear out over the next week.
Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves.
Today is a bad trigger day for me...I feel like I traded one good day for one swift kick in the nuts.
Four fucking weeks and over 1,000 dollars saved. Feels good.
This weekend was amazing... went hiking, fishing, shooting, watched some good movies, made big dinners and just overall had a good early Valentines with the wife.
I've gone this long...this must be the last time.
I've now gone five days without
I haven't been using for almost two months.
I took many meant Xanax..... Even more klonopin. Half a bottle of Jamey and a snorted a fat bag.
Each one is one closer to being better.
I think I can do this. I haven't thought that in a long time even when I made it to three days before.
Thats enough. I cant fucking do that anymore.
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.
I had a major car accident and relapsed. In back to 3days.
Almost got four days but I want to sleep so. Badly. I keep thinking just one more... (past tense 'got', present tense 'want' and 'keep') - None
It's been a month and a half... Stick with it. I was hopeless.
I've been taking opiates for about 2 years now, usually only on the weekends. I normaly take about 8-10    10/325 hydrocodone, make poppy seed tea, or if I'm lucky take a few oxy.

I've been taking hydrocodone for about 3 years now and pretty much the entire time I've been taking an average of ten 10mg pills every weekend of various acetaminophen amounts and different brands(usually they're the yellow 10/35's)
Anyways, at anytime I keep at least 40 pounds of poppyseeds incase the site I order from gets shut down, or something gets lost in the mail, by doing this, I haven't WD'd in close to 2 years,
Now I can't wait until this Friday when I get paid. I'm going to get totally straight hamstered!
I'm going to take my 60 day chip today. I am still on "step one" in my step study,
I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.
I didn't take one. I took the ibuprofen, and I relaxed and I got through the worst of it so far.
I knew as soon as I took them, the mental obsession would return.
It just takes, among the honest desire to remain clean, that dreaded time. That dreaded fucking time, the waiting, the pain; you know how it goes.
IF we can have the clarity to realize that something needs to change and decide to try to get clean.

The worst thing about a craving is that when I get one, it's not for a fuckin vicodin or two, but a needle and a bundle of downs. Ugh. Clenching my teeth lately.
These movies all make me want to get high. I've been clean for two years, but have been jonesin hard lately...
if I were to try to cop shit on the street I'd probably have a rough time, if I shot a bag of the bullshit ECP in my neck of the woods

I am about 90-100 days clean... I see so many people bummed out by recovery and I wanted to give my take on it.
I just woke up with needle in hand hanging off of my bed 2 hours after Iving about 1/6 of size I shoot every morning and night.

I just feel like i just dont have the strength. Or like wat is even the point? No doubt this is how ill go.... Be off Heroin for awhile think im doing great and fine the ill likely be back on my fucking face and using.

i have been in hospital for days due to the fact that i tryed to kill myself. I will be in here for a few more days.

So i would have been on day 32 off heroin but i ended up going back been using most of the day.

They say they'll may discharge me after the weekend.
they said they'll be discharging me tomorrow or the next day
I am 23 days off alcohol and 27 off Heroin.
I am day 8 off heroin, I will hopefully be able to have a place to stay when i get discharged.
I am two days out and i am living in a house with other clean and sober ppl.

With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals.
"Must Not Sleepâ€¦ must warn others"- I got this cause to me it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person.
My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long.

I still feel like I'm missing something. I guess I am still addicted to chaos.

This was the last time I hope I would ever use heroin.

Tomorrow marks 1 week since my last 2lb dose of PST. Symptoms have been managed with Lope for the first 2 days, and then nothing stronger than an ill advised couple Benadryl on day 3, and a few advil.
I'm currently 15 days clean off PST and wanted to post an update. Insomnia is starting to fade, restlessness no where near as bad, and the bit of mania I had last week seemed to have passed.
I have the worst headache of my life achey and chilly, when I'm not feeling on fire. My guts also are, not great.
My last few posts have been about GI issues, I was being a baby and thought my body should be back to normal after just 2 mos. clean from 2 years using.
I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years.

When I kicked opiates I also kicked caffeine, and I haven't had a drink in a long time. And I promise myself that after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine.

I'm fine. Every day is just a day now. I don't wake up in agony, thinking about a fix constantly.

I am fighting like hell, but 3 nights with no sleep? Shiiiit, I feel like a zombie that needs to run to the toilet every five. So I am on my way to see my dude, just 1 bag to split with my girl (we inn this together) just to get some sleep and get some time off this hell.

I haven't been sick in years, at least I haven't felt sick, other than withdrawals, in years.
I know I can stay sober one more day, and it's my hope you all will too!

I'm still a ways away from where I want to be, but it's insane how much better my life is today and how much I changed. ... A year ago this week was a whirlwind and this week will be too, but for totally different reasons.

Back here at day 2 yet again. Everything hurts. Feeling so hopeless.

I swear the withdrawals are just as bad if not worse than last time I detoxed even though I was doing significantly less, diff ROA and shorter time period. I'm almost 24 hours in and miserable.
Headed into day 4 now of withdrawal from bth. Far from my first rodeo but I'm at the breaking point.
Haven't slept still at all, just absolutely miserable and losing my mind. ...this morning was the worst so far.
This morning of day 7 I went to the hospital and got some non narcotic meds (clonidine, vistaril, gabapentin) to help me through. I tried kratom but it only paused the withdrawal.
I used to spend every day wishing I was dead when I was using, who knew I'd get clean and feel the same.
We aren't super hard core users like we used to be, but we like to get down when the feelin is right.

I wasn't ever a huge gamer, but twice a week I would be able to sit in front of an Xbox or computer for a couple hours and indulge in fantasy world. But now, the thought of playing sounds absolutely boring.
When we don't eat healthily our entire bodies pretty much shut down and we both become very tired, irritable, and lack motivation.

These 6 months of recovery have been fucking amazing!! I started at the very bottom at a sales job, and have worked my way close to the top. Just got promoted to sales manager last week! I'm making great money, and will be in the market for my own little condo by summer.
